New Records: Aaron Judge ended the longest home run drought of his career with a go-ahead grand slam in the seventh inning
Aaron Judge's eighth career slam and second this season sent the Yankee Stadium crowd into a jumping, dancing frenzy
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a go-ahead grand slam in the seventh inning to rally the New York Yankees past the Boston Red Sox 5-4
Trevor Story hit a two-run shot off Mark Leiter Jr. in the seventh for a 4-0 lead
Masataka Yoshida connected for a two-run homer that chased Clarke Schmidt with two outs in the sixth
Pre-Game Insights: The New York Yankees won its third straight and extended its AL East lead to three games over Baltimore
The fading Red Sox are 4 1/2 games behind Minnesota for the league's last wild card
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge said 'Hopefully nobody's looking at the standings' after the win
Aaron Judge said 'Just got to keep it rolling' after the win
Luke Weaver struck out five in two scoreless innings to earn his second career save
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Yankee Stadium in front of a crowd of 45,292
The Yankees' largest cushion in the AL East since June 15 was extended to three games
Red Sox manager Alex Cora said he hopes Rob Refsnyder can start Sunday against left-hander Carlos Rod√≥n
Others: Aaron Judge hadn't gone deep since Aug. 25, when he homered twice against Colorado
Trevor Story hit his first home run this season after returning last weekend from a dislocated left shoulder
Red Sox RHP Liam Hendriks said he still hopes to pitch for the Red Sox this season despite a small setback in his rehabilitation from Tommy John surgery
